law.catch_line: Legislative intent and findings for KRS 211.680 to 211.686 and KRS 72.029.
law.text:
The Kentucky General Assembly declares that the purpose of KRS 211.680 to 211.686 and KRS 72.029 is to reduce the number of child fatalities. The General Assembly finds that establishing priorities and developing programs to prevent child fatalities requires the:
Accurate determination of the cause and manner of death;
Cooperation and communication among agencies responsible for the investigation of child fatalities; and
Collection and analysis of data to:
Identify trends, patterns, and risk factors; and
Evaluate the effectiveness of prevention and intervention strategies.
law.history: Created 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 347, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1996.
